name: Impact
description: The Impact class allows for categorizing and describing the technical impact of the incident on the network of an organization.

lang.name: lang
lang.description: A valid language code per RFC 4646 [7] constrained by the definition of "xs:language".  The interpretation of this code is described in Section 6.

severity.name: severity
severity.description: An estimate of the relative severity of the activity.  The permitted values are shown below.  There is no default value.

completion.name: completion
completion.description: An indication whether the described activity was successful.  The permitted values are shown below.  There is no default value.

values.description: The attempted activity was not successful.

type.name: type
type.description: Classifies the malicious activity into incident categories.  The permitted values are shown below.  The default value is "other".

values.description: A denial of service was attempted.
An action that impacts the integrity of a file or database was attempted.
An attempt was made to exfiltrate information.
An attempt was made to exploit a mis- configuration in a system.
Activity violating site's policy was attempted.
A social engineering attack was attempted.
The classification of this activity is unknown.
An escape value used to extend this attribute. See Section 5.1.

ext-type.name: ext-type
ext-type.description: A means by which to extend the type attribute. See Section 5.1.
